channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Trump extends TikTok reprieve as deal nears
item.description: While legally questionable, the extension comes just as it appears China and the U.S. may finally have a deal on TikTok's fate.
item.content:encoded:
While legally questionable, the extension comes just as it appears China and the U.S. may finally have a deal on TikTok's fate.

(Image credit: Kevin Dietsch)
item.dc:creator: Geoff Brumfiel

item.title: 'People are scared': Congress grapples with increasing political violence
item.description: House Republicans put forth a proposal to fund the government that includes $30 million for lawmaker security, as Congress grapples with increasing political violence.
item.content:encoded:
House Republicans put forth a proposal to fund the government that includes $30 million for lawmaker security, as Congress grapples with increasing political violence.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Barbara Sprunt

item.title: The U.S. said it would burn $9.7 million of birth control. Its fate is still unclear
item.description: Questions about their fate swirled after the government's July deadline for destruction came and went. Then came a false report they'd been incinerated. Aid groups say it's not too late to save them.
item.content:encoded:
Questions about their fate swirled after the government's July deadline for destruction came and went. Then came a false report they'd been incinerated. Aid groups say it's not too late to save them.

(Image credit: Marta Fiorin)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: RFK Jr. wants to end mental health screenings in schools. Experts say it's a bad idea
item.description: Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy and Education Secretary Linda McMahon are against schools giving kids standardized questionnaires about their mental well-being. But experts say they are wrong.
item.content:encoded:
Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy and Education Secretary Linda McMahon are against schools giving kids standardized questionnaires about their mental well-being. But experts say they are wrong.

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla)
item.dc:creator: Rhitu Chatterjee

item.title: From heart to skin to hair, 'Replaceable You' dives into the science of transplant
item.description: Science writer Mary Roach chronicles both the history and the latest science of body part replacement in her new book. She also answers the question: Is it kosher to receive an organ donation from a pig?
item.content:encoded:
Fuzz: When Nature Breaks the Law and Stiff: The Curious Lives of Human Cadavers.'/>

Science writer Mary Roach chronicles both the history and the latest science of body part replacement in her new book. She also answers the question: Is it kosher to receive an organ donation from a pig?

(Image credit: Jen Siska)
item.dc:creator: Terry Gross

item.title: Utah files murder charges against Tyler Robinson
item.description: Utah prosecutors charged Tyler Robinson, 22, with the murder of conservative activist Charlie Kirk. Officials say they are seeking the death penalty.
item.content:encoded:
Utah prosecutors charged Tyler Robinson, 22, with the murder of conservative activist Charlie Kirk. Officials say they are seeking the death penalty.

(Image credit: Utah Governor's Office)
item.dc:creator: Bobby Allyn

item.title: Republicans release 7-week spending bill as Democrats warn of a potential shutdown
item.description: House Republicans released a short-term spending bill to fund the government until late November but Democrats are calling for further changes.
item.content:encoded:
House Republicans released a short-term spending bill to fund the government until late November but Democrats are calling for further changes.

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla)
item.dc:creator: Deirdre Walsh

item.title: Has everyday life changed due to increased ICE activity in your area? We want to know
item.description: NPR wants to hear from listeners whose lives have changed due to an increase in ICE operations, throughout the country.
item.content:encoded:
NPR wants to hear from listeners whose lives have changed due to an increase in ICE operations, throughout the country.

(Image credit: Michael M. Santiago)
item.dc:creator: NPR Staff

item.title: A U.N. inquiry accuses Israel of genocide in Gaza, joining a rising chorus
item.description: The report issued Tuesday by experts commissioned by the United Nations' Human Rights Council calls on the international community to end the genocide and take steps to punish those responsible.
item.content:encoded:
The report issued Tuesday by experts commissioned by the United Nations' Human Rights Council calls on the international community to end the genocide and take steps to punish those responsible.

(Image credit: Yousef Al Zanoun)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Movie star and visionary Robert Redford has died at age 89
item.description: A movie star to his core, Robert Redford has died after a visionary career in cinema, including founding the Sundance Institute that transformed the market for independent films.
item.content:encoded:
A movie star to his core, Robert Redford has died after a visionary career in cinema, including founding the Sundance Institute that transformed the market for independent films.

(Image credit: Victor Blackman)
item.dc:creator: Neda Ulaby
